posts.post_content:
If this would have been printed as a demon from Rakdos for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol),  
i would not have had any doubts that this was, in fact, a demon.  
Those chains and the gloomy, fire-lit background seem to suggest  
that the scene takes place somewhere underground.  
  
So i actually wonder if this artwork was originally intended for a Rakdos demon.  
I'm not going to complain though - this is a great beast card.

posts.post_content:
My new rg std beater:  
  
Waif  
Captive  
Mayor  
Mauler  
Emissary  
Kruin   
Rampager  
  
Rancor  
Revenge of the hunted  
2x wrath  
  
4x crag  
9 mt 9 frst  
  
Its based around being too fast to stop. It can get 10 or so dmg in before a verdict hits. Then get a flipped kruin out, rush it and swing for game.   
  
Funny this is the only gruul card that stacks up to the wolves. I was considering rubblebelt as well but its vulnerable and lacks evasion. Oh, the bloodrush snake is pretty tight too. Also thinking of wrecking ogre, just for the bloodrush. Too much mana tho, i like being confident with three lands. Deadbridge can also add some much needed late game. A final thought was domri x 2, but planeswalkers weigh u down in these colors. Also, I pride myself on this being a budget deck, that can be built for about $20 on amazon (provided you have at least a few rancors and crags to start) and it can stand up to decks where literally every single card is about $20. Granted it will die horrible deaths to serenity, bu... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Rampager is bonkers. It's almost like someone said "How can we make [Colossal Might](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Colossal Might) better? Why by giving you the option to play it as a 4/4 with trample of course!"  
  
Sure can only play it when you attack, but who cares when your hitting your opponent for 6,7, or 8? Oh and it's a creature with trample when you need it. For four mana. I love bloodrush.  
  
Absolutely love this card. 4.7/5
